name: Chifley Alice Springs Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here over xmas 2007 for 4 nights. There was a mix up with the room when we first checked in to the hotel, but staff were apologetic and quickly fixed the problem. Pool bar was closed and I don't actually think that it ever opens- but staff walk around so it was easy enough to order drinks and have them delivered poolside.
reviews.title: Food in restaurant overpriced - Find somewhere else to eat !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant staff were efficient and friendly but the food was terrible.
reviews.title: Expensive for what it was
Good but for restaurant service
reviews.text: We thought the first bad meals were just the chef having a bad night and went another night which proved to be a big mistake. Overpriced- overcooked and undercooked- my suggestion is to eat elsewhere. Overall this is an expensive hotel for what it is - accommodation meals and drinks.
We stayed in the River Gum Court Deluxe Rooms as the Tripadvisor reviews on the other hotels in Alice Springs and the other rooms at Alice Springs Resort had such bad reviews on tripadvisor.
reviews.title: overpriced and grubby

likes.liked: — convenient location close to town centre

reviews.text: The room was clean but nothing special and over-priced.
reviews.title: Passable but nothing special
Nice and relaxing hotel
reviews.text: We spent one night at the Alice Springs resort on our honeymoon and enjoyed it very much.

reviews.title: Great hotel
reviews.text: Our room was with TODD river view, that although flows underground, creates a nice unusual sight.
The room was large enough with a comfortable bed and equipped with everything we needed, included a superb air-conditioning system, really helpful as it was +39°C and wet.
reviews.title: Best in the Alice

reviews.text: The bathroom was spacious and there were both a shower and a bathtub.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Alice Springs -- By Far
Fantastic Flying Visit!
reviews.text: Our room was quite far away from the reception but they took care of moving back and forth our luggage.
Pleasent hotel, fairly good location but very expensive for what is really just a basic motel type accommodation.
reviews.title: Basic hotel

reviews.text: Plenty of staff on recpetion but only one can check you in. If you arrive on the airport shuttle as many people do make sure you are off first to avoid a long wait!
reviews.title: Loved the city
oke but overpriced
reviews.text: Food was good by the pool at lunch didn't eat there in the evenings. Room was large with two double beds, we had a disabled bathroom which was also large.

We loved knocking about Alice Springs, wish we could have stayed longer. Lots of things to keep you busy for a few days. The Alice Springs Resort was proposed to us as 'First Class' accomodations, but is far from it. It is an older hotel, the bathrooms look like they belonged on a Japanese cruise ship. No ledge or shelf of any kind to place toilet articles. Recommend the Crowne Plaza or the Hotel at Lassiter's Casino for better quality rooms.
reviews.title: Good, basic hotel

reviews.text: I stayed here for 3 days in september last year. The hotel is oke and the staff were helpfull. But given the price you pay it is basic. The resort has a monopoly position and use it. We booked the sound of silence diner and loved it. If you have the oppurtinity, just do it.
reviews.title: ok hotel - rooms kinda dumpy...

reviews.text: Hotel was clean but old. Very easy to walk to the downtown. Ate all of our meals out and stocked up at the supermarket. All easy walks.
reviews.title: Nothing Special

reviews.text: We stayed one night at this hotel after a flight from Adelaide. We had dinner at the attraction, Take a Camel to Dinner. We enjoyed the dinner and the camel ride was okay. The next morning we took a bus to Ayers Rock. The hotel has a great location for visiting Alice Springs to which we walked. The room was nice with a comfortable bed and the breakfast which was included was satisfying.
reviews.title: Pleasant hotel

reviews.text: I stayed one night at this property, and one night was too many. My room was in the supposedly refurbished Palm Court wing, but the room was more like a cheap motel room or one level up from a dorm room. The lock on the door malfunctioned, and I never knew if the deadbolt was working properly when I returned to my room.
reviews.title: Scary place to stay

reviews.text: There is no light inside the entrance, but there is a huge and ugly fluorescent globe fixture in the centre of the room - looked like a recycled kitchen light fixture. All of the lights in the room are those compact fluorescent bulbs that give off an ugly blue cast to the room, which - when reflected off the eggplant and taupe carpet, drapes and bedcovers - made for a pretty depressing room. You felt as if you were sleeping in a kitchen or laboratory.
reviews.title: Nothing special but comfortable after 2 nights camping
Better than expected
reviews.text: The bathroom had a shower stall with just a hole in the floor and a flimsy curtain surrounding the stall. Granted, the room was wheelchair-accessible, which explained the bare-bones esthetic of the bathroom, but the rest of the room was not much of an improvement.

description: Chifley Alice Springs Resort combines efficient and friendly outback service with modern, comfortable facilities. Low rise architecture and lush green lawns contribute to the relaxed atmosphere of this award-winning resort, situated on the banks of the famous Todd River with its magnificent river red gums. Guests can relax in the stylish surroundings and enjoy a sumptuous full buffet breakfast, a la carte lunches, and contemporary cuisine dinners at the Barra on Todd Restaurant. Located adjacent to the restaurant, the Barra Bar offers guests the opportunity to surf the Internet while enjoying a drink from the fine selection of beers, wines, and cocktails. The 4.5 Star resort has 139 guest rooms and hotels facilities include 24 hour reception, FREE WiFi resort-wide, swimming pool, cardio room, free town shuttle, guest laundry, restaurant, bar and complimentary onsite parking. The hotel is only a five minute walk away from the town's bustling cultural, shopping and business centre. It is a convenient pick up point for the many local sightseeing tours available in and around Alice Springs, making Chifley Alice Springs Resort the perfect base for exploring the Outback attractions in and around the town. Chifley Alice Springs Resort is the perfect venue with well equipped with modern conference and meeting facilities for business events, functions, conferences, launches, weddings & cocktail parties.
